briefdescription.para: The maximum age of a key before we create a new key to use in challenges.

detaileddescription.para: This isn't super-reliably enforced, since system clocks can change or be wrong, but we make a best effort to only use keys for a short time.

briefdescription.para: The time after which we drop a key from the secrets file.

detaileddescription.para: The EXPIRE_KEYS_TIMEOUT_SECONDS - NEW_KEY_TIMEOUT_SECONDS is the minimum time window a client has to complete authentication.

briefdescription.para: The maximum amount of time a key can be in the future.
Maximum number of keys in the keyring before we just ignore the rest.
Maximum number of timeouts waiting for lock before we decide it's stale.
Length of each timeout while waiting for a lock.
Reloads the keyring file, optionally adds one new key to the file, removes all expired keys from the file iff a key was added, then resaves the file.

detaileddescription.para: Stores the keys from the file in keyring->keys. Note that the file is only resaved (written to) if a key is added, this means that only servers ever write to the file and need to lock it, which avoids a lot of lock contention at login time and such.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE to add a new key to the file, expire keys, and resave

briefdescription.para: Increments reference count of the keyring.
Decrements refcount and finalizes if it reaches zero.
Creates a new keyring that lives in the ~/.dbus-keyrings directory of the user represented by credentials.

detaileddescription.para: If the credentials are NULL or empty, uses those of the current process.

parameterdescription.para: a set of credentials representing a user or NULL

simplesect.para: the keyring or NULL on error

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the context is a valid context.

detaileddescription.para: Contexts that might cause confusion when used in filenames are not allowed (contexts can't start with a dot or contain dir separators).

xrefdescription.para: this is the most inefficient implementation imaginable.

briefdescription.para: Gets a recent key to use for authentication.

detaileddescription.para: If no recent key exists, creates one. Returns the key ID. If a key can't be written to the keyring file so no recent key can be created, returns -1. All valid keys are > 0.

simplesect.para: key ID to use for auth, or -1 on failure

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the keyring is for the same user as the given credentials.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the keyring belongs to the given user

briefdescription.para: Gets the hex-encoded secret key for the given ID.

detaileddescription.para: Returns FALSE if not enough memory. Returns TRUE but empty key on any other error such as unknown key ID.

parameterdescription.para: string to append hex-encoded key to

simplesect.para: TRUE if we had enough memory
